newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber ends steady despite Tokyo's fall.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber ends steady despite Tokyo's fall.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended the week steady on sheet grade covering but dealing continued listless as buyers stayed at the sidelines in anticipation of falling prices, dealers said.

"Consumers are not committing themselves although local prices are much lower than other producers like Thailand and Indonesia," a dealer said. "Thailand raw materials have gone much dearer after the recent government intervention."
"Buyers from Asia, like the Chinese and South Koreans were just making their enquiries but did not buy anything. They know prices will dip further as Tokyo was bearish."
"There is a surplus of raw materials in the local market and local suppliers are lowering prices to attract buyers," another dealer at a trading firm said.
Several local glove manufacturers were making enquiries for nearby latex rubber and some trades have been transacted.
Dealers were unable to confirm exact transactions as business was done from hand-to-mouth basis.

Trading houses quoted SMR CV at 328 -330 cents, SMR L at 305-307 cents, SMR 10 at 260-262 and drum latex at 226. June RSS 1 buyer was officially closed at 278.50 cents ($1.11) a kg, up a cent from Thursday, and June SMR 20 buyer was unchanged at 264
